project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently when planning a sprint, dragging the sprint bar adds issues to the new sprint according to the order the issues are shown. If I have 40 issues and drag the bar down by 10, I get 10 issues in the new sprint and 30 outside. Dragging individual issues around lets me change this.
However, when using filters, the plan mode does exactly the same - namely _showing_ 15 total filtered issues while there are _actually_ 40 issues. Dragging the bar down by 10 adds _at least_ 10 issues, and depending on the filter it may add up to 35 because the bar still adds them according to their order and not according to their *visible* order.

And this is the main reason we cannot really use the Rapid Board, being stuck with the old Classic Boards.

Using the Epic or Version filter for example, we get the planned issues for the version and want to divide them into smaller sprints. Doing that however not only adds issue of the selected Version/Epic, but also ones that are merely hidden by the filter.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like filters to cause the plan mode to change the order when moving the sprint bar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*
* Login to the instance (with automatic login enabled, aka remember me).
* Quit browser to end session.
* Enter board URL
* Being redirected to login
* Being redirected to https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa (no query)


*Actual Results*
Being redirected to https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa (no query) and it doesn't remember the board's URL ID.


*Expected Results*
Should be redirected to the board's URL that has been entered by the user earlier.
fields.summary: GreenHopper is not redirecting to the board's URL after closing the browser

fields.description:
Currently the supported operators for the 'sprint' field are: 
=, !=, >, >=, <, <= ,IS ,IS NOT ,IN and NOT IN

An improvement would be to allow historical searches 
WAS & WAS NOT

To allow a user to query when new issues were added to a sprint:
example: 
{code}sprint = x AND Sprint WAS NOT x ON "dd/mm/yyyy"{code}
fields.summary: Allow historical search operators (was, was not) for the 'sprint' field

fields.description:
Using the Agile Board as a Scrum Project it will always show all the Epics of the whole project. The filter applied for Component or Version do not filter the Epics Issues. 

But on the Classic Board, the Epics are filtered correctly.

I need to filter the Backlog on the Board showing only Epics from a specific version or component.
fields.summary: Filter Epic based on target version/component

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We observed this behavior today for several developers in our production system and I was able to reproduce it in the staging system as well as for the latest JIRA + GH. 

h3.Steps to reproduce:
# Prepare a SCRUM board for project 'DEMO'
# Create a new sprint and start it
# Remove 'Schedule Issues' permission for 'Developer' from permission scheme
# Login as a sample user with 'Developer' role for project DEMO
# Drag any issue from the backlog into the active sprint

h3.Outcome:

*Setup #1 (JIRA 5.1.5, GH 6.1.3.1)*
# Green box saying the issue has been added to the active sprint
# Red box saying permissions for ranking are missing
# Issue disappears from the backlog and after a refresh (F5) either:
#* appears in the active sprint
#* {color:red}still appears in the backlog <- In this case, opening the issue in the JIRA issue view, the Agile tab shows it in the active sprint (!!!){color}
# {color:red}The burndown does not show the scope change (\!){color}

*Setup #2 (JIRA 5.2.10, GH 6.2)*
# Green box saying the issue has been added to the active sprint
# Red box saying permissions for ranking are missing
# Issue disappears from the backlog but appears in the active sprint after a refresh (F5)

*Expectations:*
- I would expect that a regular developer cannot add an issue to a sprint since this is actually a way more severe operation that ranking it.
- The issue should not disappear from the backlog / sprint even if an error message is thrown
- The reporting seems to miss the scope change in some cases (I am still trying to reproduce this on GH 6.2 - I might upgrade our staging system using a copy of the production data)
fields.summary: Able to add issue to active sprint when 'Schedule Issues' permission is not granted

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When viewing the plan board on a small screen, using the horizontal scrollbar causes only the middle column (backlog) to move, while the right column (user story) stays static and at least partially outside the browser window. See attached screenshots.

The issue occurs on all of FF 20, Chrome 26, IE 9.
fields.summary: Unable to see issue when using horizontal scroll bar on plan board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The workflow we use is:

1) create bug report in Bonfire
2) click link to new issue detail page provided by Bonfire
3) click "View on Board" link
4) click gear on issue card
5) click "Send to Top"
6) scroll to top of backlog
7) drag issue into current sprint

Steps 4-7 could be avoided by simply having links to that say "Add to Sprint XYZ" in addition to the "View on Board" link.
fields.summary: As scrum master, I want to add an issue to an active sprint from the issue detail page.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Users of our instance have requested the ability to generate charts like those already provided as the "Agile Gadget", except that they want to be able to specify a parameter that is normally calculated, and see how that impacts the chart.

The specific case they are asking for is to be able to specify a particular velocity, and then see how that impacts the time required to fully burn down a daily statistic to complete the work in the version. I don't know all the particulars of how the chart data is calculated, so I can't be more specific about how such a thing would be implemented.

This is one case, and there may be others that make sense to also provide for those working potential scenarios based on parameters that are not normally inputs.
fields.summary: Support "what if" configurations for agile gadgets

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-8630].
  {panel}

When viewing an issue, there is a 'View on Board' link in the Agile Section. Command+click or Ctrl+click the 'View on Board' link, opens the issue again in a popup window (but everything appears messed) overlapping the current issue:

!view_on_board.png|thumbnail!

Problem reproduced using Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox.

P.S.: Command+click or Ctrl+click in another links displayed on the page opens the link on a new page without any problems.
fields.summary: The "View on Board" option does not open in a new tab

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Open Plan Mode or Work Mode
# Choose an issue which is in an active sprint (and hence Estimate is not editable)
# Click on Summary to edit
# Type a new value
# Tab to submit the edit

Focus shifts to Description, the next editable field. However the issue detail view header (which contains Summary) has been shifted/scrolled, with no way to return it to normal (reloading detail view fixes it).

See video.
fields.summary: Tabbing out of editing issue summary causes detail view header to be displaced

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I need to be able to track the original estimate as constant. 

Actual:
If a user edits directly in the 'Remaining:' field in the work view the value is copied to the Original Estimate field and overwrites the value. This is not the case if the user clicks the '+' and enters work on the Log Work Form.

Expected:
Editing remaining estimate would not effect original estimate
fields.summary: Editing Remaining Estimate in Work View changes Original Estimate to the same value

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you have more than three columns in your board or change the name from the "In Progress" column, like this:

!columns.png!


The Agile Gadget will not respect this changes, or even give an option to use those columns:

!gadget.png!


We should have an option to use the columns from the board or make this the default behavior in the gadget.
fields.summary: The Agile Gadget should respect the columns from the board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When seeing the [*GreenHopper Sprint Burndown Gadget*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+the+Sprint+Burndown+Gadget], the horizontal axis displays the days of the Sprint. If the Sprint's End Date is set to a date in the past, however, the axis will show all days until the current date.

*+Expected Results:+*
When viewing the Gadget, the horizontal axis would show from the Sprint's ??Start Date?? to the ??End Date??.

*+Actual Results:+*
If viewing a Sprint in which the ??End Date?? is set to a day in the past, the horizontal axis shows from the Sprint's ??Start Date?? to the current date.

*+Steps to Replicate:+*
# Create a Sprint;
# Change the ??Start Date?? and ??End Date?? values to dates in the past;
# Add the *GreenHopper Sprint Burndown Gadget* to a Dashboard and configure it to show the Sprint created;
# See what is displayed.

*+Screenshots:+*
|| Future Date || Past Date ||
| !Future Date - Gadget.png|align=center! 
----
 !Future Date - Sprint.png! | !Past Date - Gadget.png|align=center! 
----
 !Past Date - Sprint.png! |
fields.summary: GreenHopper Sprint Burndown Gadget shows through 'today' instead of through the sprint end date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Repro:
Release issues (more issues take longer making it easier to hit) then close dialog before the release completes. When it does and the dialog has already been closed, it chokes on null. Workaround: wait for the release to complete on its own before closing the dialog.

Release will work fine in the background so no functionality is impacted.

GH Version 6.2-rc1 on JIRA v6.0-beta1#6080-sha1:a27d578 at ~19:05 24 April Sydney.

{noformat}
An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'hide' of null
Resource: https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/s/en_UK-bgdh3d-1988229788/6080/67/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js
Line: 226
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_7_5) AppleWebKit/537.31 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/26.0.1410.65 Safari/537.31
{noformat}
fields.summary: 'cannot call method hide of null' is thrown when releasing from Kanban board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I would like to be able to edit fields directly from the 'detail view' of the 'Plan' or 'Work' screens.

My team doesn't use a numeric system to score tasks, so I have a custom drop-down field with the possible options. This has a lot of downstream usability effects (I'll drop another feature request with some suggestions for that particular bee's nest), but the biggest pain-point we're having right now is that we have to open each issue individually to score it during sprint planning. I see that a few of the fields are editable now, but it would be awesome if we could allow or disallow editing on all of the fields instead of having a few hard-coded.
fields.summary: Inline Editing of Fields in 'Detailed View' Pane

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I want to be able to add info such as alerts, dates, sprint goals, and other project related things on the sprint task board (top nav.) where it is viewable by the scrum team

My team recently transitioned to GH and as a Scrum master, I find that being able to put project related notifications in a bulletin board type feature where everyone can view it will be very helpful. With the current GH version, there is no way of doing this, so I had to became creative. I am using the GH board name field to display some of the important info I need the team to know about. See screenshot. 
Usage for a bulletin board type feature can be endless e.g. any project dates, quick project related info/alert team should know about, even inspirational quotes, just to name a few!

I would really would love to see this feature on GH and I know it will be helpful to many. Thanks and keep up the good work!
fields.summary: As a scrum master, I want to be able to add info such as alerts, dates, sprint goals, and other project related things on the sprint task board (top nav.) where it is viewable by the scrum team

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When deleting a board in Greenhopper, the associated filter is not deleted. This can lead to thousands of *abandoned / unused filters* in a Jira installation.

For example:
!image001.JPG|thumbnail!

!image002.JPG|thumbnail!

!image003.JPG|thumbnail!

As a user it would be great to have a ability to prompt an option to choose for deleting a saved filter. To reduce the waste of creating saved filter in future.
fields.summary: Prompt a option for user to delete a saved filter when a board is deleted.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Whenever we edit an issue in Greenhopper plan mode (maybe others to), not inline, but by pressing "e" on the keyboard for instance, resolution is set and the key has strikethrough. This has not been the case earlier. The field "resolution" is required so it automatically sets it to fixed.

This does not happen when we do inline editing on say description or is we edit the issue in Jira.

* Atlassian GreenHopper (v6.1.6)

* Atlassian JIRA (v5.2.4.1#846-sha1:7ae4d02)
fields.summary: Editing an issue in plan mode set the resolution

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to switch contexts with users that contain upper-case characters in their username ({{cwd_user.username}}) unless it's a shared filter. Lowercase users seem to work without error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a mixed-case user in an LDAP engine.
# Set up a JIRA User Directory so that user is imported.
# Log in as the user (e.g.: {{Captain.Planet}}).
# Create a new context.
# Change the context to default and then to the new context.

h3. Expected Results

It switches context.

h3. Actual Results

The context goes back to the default and does not switch.

h3. Notes

This works for lower-case users and if the context is shared the mixed-case users can access it.
fields.summary: When changing GreenHopper context it goes back to the default

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
One issue's Story Points with two fixVersions only counts towards one (the first one added in the fixversion field) of the version's Total Story Points.

See screenshots

Story points of an estimated issue should be added to the total story points of all fix versions it's assigned to.
fields.summary: Story Points from issue with multiple fixVersion only counts against one version's Total Story Points

Our commitment will be of 20 points
If we remove an issue for any reason in active sprint. 
The points are removed from the commitment in the velocity chart. 

We did commit to do those points. why are they removed?

Regards
fields.summary: In Agile Velocity Report, The commitment is not representative of the real commitment (Story point)
